intro: Chromatotriccum fulgidum, commonly known as the golden haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and the presence of yellowish-green to golden-colored capsules that mature in late summer. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its leaves are typically elongated and have a distinct midrib, with a smooth or slightly toothed margin. Chromatotriccum fulgidum plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
